1.text: Simon Peter, a servant and an apostle of Jesus Christ, to them that have obtained like precious faith with us through the righteousness of God and our Savior Jesus Christ:

2.text: Grace and peace be multiplied to you through the knowledge of God, and of Jesus our Lord,

3.text: According as his divine power has given to us all things that pertain to life and godliness, through the knowledge of him that has called us to glory and virtue:

4.text: Whereby are given to us exceeding great and precious promises: that by these you might be partakers of the divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust.

5.text: And beside this, giving all diligence, add to your faith virtue; and to virtue knowledge;

6.text: And to knowledge temperance; and to temperance patience; and to patience godliness;

7.text: And to godliness brotherly kindness; and to brotherly kindness charity.

8.text: For if these things be in you, and abound, they make you that you shall neither be barren nor unfruitful in the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.

9.text: But he that lacks these things is blind, and cannot see afar off, and has forgotten that he was purged from his old sins.

10.text: Why the rather, brothers, give diligence to make your calling and election sure: for if you do these things, you shall never fall:

11.text: For so an entrance shall be ministered to you abundantly into the everlasting kingdom of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.

12.text: Why I will not be negligent to put you always in remembrance of these things, though you know them, and be established in the present truth.

13.text: Yes, I think it meet, as long as I am in this tabernacle, to stir you up by putting you in remembrance;

14.text: Knowing that shortly I must put off this my tabernacle, even as our Lord Jesus Christ has showed me.

15.text: Moreover I will endeavor that you may be able after my decease to have these things always in remembrance.

16.text: For we have not followed cunningly devised fables, when we made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, but were eyewitnesses of his majesty.

17.text: For he received from God the Father honor and glory, when there came such a voice to him from the excellent glory, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.

18.text: And this voice which came from heaven we heard, when we were with him in the holy mount.

19.text: We have also a more sure word of prophecy; whereunto you do well that you take heed, as to a light that shines in a dark place, until the day dawn, and the day star arise in your hearts:

20.text: Knowing this first, that no prophecy of the scripture is of any private interpretation.

21.text: For the prophecy came not in old time by the will of man: but holy men of God spoke as they were moved by the Holy Ghost.
